data.title: Add Undo and Redo buttons
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.11.2
- OS Version: Windows 10

Steps to Reproduce:

1. There is no undo or redo button.  One can use Ctrl+Z and Ctrl+Y but it is often easier to have buttons.  This had been an issue but someone created a plugin as detailed at http://stackoverflow.com/questions/819846/how-to-add-undo-redo-buttons-to-toolbar-in-eclipse

It would be helpful to add Undo and Redo buttons to the interface.

data.title: Allow setting TSLint max-line-length
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.11.2
- OS Version: Windows 10

Steps to Reproduce:

0.  Try to have a line over 140 characters and TSLint warns "Exceeds maximum line length of 140 (max-line-length)"
1.  Try to overrule this by adding setting "tslint.max-line-length": [true, 160] (format taken from https://palantir.github.io/tslint/rules/max-line-length/ )
2.  Response is "Unknown configuration setting"

Desired behavior:
One should be able to set max-line-length

data.title: All of, or a subset of these colors should be white/black with transparency
data.body:
#25328

- VSCode Version: Code - Insiders 1.12.0-insider (48ae6e3027be560d45dd1ebfbe090d6ff77af7f0, 2017-04-26T06:32:53.505Z)
- OS Version: Linux x64 4.10.0-19-generic
- Extensions: 

|Extension|Author|Version|
|---|---|---|
|EditorConfig|EditorConfig|0.9.3|
|lorem-ipsum|Tyriar|1.0.0|
|sort-lines|Tyriar|1.2.0|
|theme-sapphire|Tyriar|0.1.0|
|vscode-svgviewer|cssho|1.4.0|
|tslint|eg2|0.12.0|
|git-project-manager|felipecaputo|1.3.2|
|md-navigate|jrieken|0.0.1|
|vscode-scss|mrmlnc|0.6.2|
|vetur|octref|0.6.3|
|seti-icons|qinjia|0.1.3|;

---

I went through all the colors for the generator and put the following into the bucket for using white (on dark) and black (on light) with transparency. These values should apply nicely pretty much everywhere as the color is just a lighter or darker version of their background color.

```
"listActiveSelectionBackground": "",
"listDropBackground": "",
"listFocusAndSelectionBackground": "",
"listFocusBackground": "",
"listHoverBackground": "",
"listInactiveFocusBackground": "",
"listInactiveSelectionBackground": "",
"editorLineHighlight": "",
"editorLineHighlightBorder": "",
"editorRangeHighlight": "", // Highlight on rows on find
"editorDragAndDropBackground": "", // DND overlay
"activityBarDragAndDropBackground": "",
"panelActiveTitleBorder": "",
"sideBarSectionHeaderBackground": "", // eg. Debug collapsible sections
"statusBarItemActiveBackground": "", // Mouse down
"statusBarItemHoverBackground": "",
"pickerGroupBorder": "",
```

data.title: Theme name should not be optional
data.body:
Test #25341 

> What's the name of your theme shown to the user?

Users can skip this question/ press enter directly when running `yo code`, and the result is users wil l get a theme file named as `-color-theme.json`. IMHO we need to make this a must-have option.

data.title: colorCustomizations: Do we need editorLinkForeground?
data.body:
#25328

- VSCode Version: Code - Insiders 1.12.0-insider (48ae6e3027be560d45dd1ebfbe090d6ff77af7f0, 2017-04-26T06:32:53.505Z)
- OS Version: Linux x64 4.10.0-19-generic
- Extensions: 

|Extension|Author|Version|
|---|---|---|
|EditorConfig|EditorConfig|0.9.3|
|lorem-ipsum|Tyriar|1.0.0|
|sort-lines|Tyriar|1.2.0|
|theme-sapphire|Tyriar|0.1.0|
|vscode-svgviewer|cssho|1.4.0|
|tslint|eg2|0.12.0|
|git-project-manager|felipecaputo|1.3.2|
|md-navigate|jrieken|0.0.1|
|vscode-scss|mrmlnc|0.6.2|
|vetur|octref|0.6.3|
|seti-icons|qinjia|0.1.3|;

---

`editorLinkForeground` is similar to `editorActiveLinkForeground` but instead of needing ctrl/cmd held with mouse over it colors the link all the time. As far as I can tell we're not using this in any theme and it could only do harm imo. Coloring the text should be the role of the textmate scopes. We already underline them, why give users the option of overriding the links?

For example, this is clearly invalid json due to the coloring:

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/2193314/25456068/b96e60ba-2a86-11e7-930e-3544eafabe49.png)

It's not so clear with `"editorLinkForeground": "#FFFF00"`:

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/2193314/25456108/d2381d5c-2a86-11e7-85b1-b1189f7f7379.png)

Overrides coloring in comments/strings:

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/2193314/25456190/07e01324-2a87-11e7-9384-3b31bf10f243.png)

data.title: Restart Frame While Debugging TS Jumps To JS Source

milestone.title: On Deck
milestone.description:
The Issues assigned to the **On Deck** milestone under consideration for the upcoming milestones.
Our goal is to always have less than 100 Issues on deck.

data.body:
**Steps to reproduce**
1. Debug a ts file using node debugger. Make sure source maps are enabled and that there is a stack frame in your source in the call stack
2. Click on `restart frame` for this frame

**Expected**
Stays in ts file

**Actual**
Jumps to js implementation file

![apr-26-2017 13-45-20](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/12821956/25456088/c65eb090-2a86-11e7-9912-8b5385ad7d99.gif)

data.title: Monarch questions
data.body: Where is the best place to ask questions about [Monarch](https://microsoft.github.io/monaco-editor/monarch.html) and creating a custom language? [monaco-editor](https://github.com/Microsoft/monaco-editor) issues don't seem to be active.

data.title: Stackframe not greyed out when skipped and toggling doesnt work
data.body:
Testing #25323

- OS Version: Windows

I followed the same code in #25323 and added another `b.callback(f);` in the end of `a.ts`

Steps to Reproduce:

1. In launch.json add `"skipFiles": ["${workspaceRoot}/b.js"]`
2. Add breakpoints on the 2 calls to `b.callback(f)`
3. Start debugging
4. When the first breakpoint is hit, Step in. The file is skipped as expected and control is in f()
5. The stackframe is as below.

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/16890566/25455516/f42f6930-2a84-11e7-8d92-65401333787f.png)

I would expect the `callback` from `b.ts` to be greyed out because it has been skipped, but its not

6. Choose "Toggle Skipping this file" on the "callback" stackframe
7. Hit F5, breakpoint hits the second `b.callback(f), Step In
8. I expect to be inside the file `b.ts` because we toggled skipping of the file, but the file is still skipped.

data.title: Makefile parsing bug?
data.body:
<!-- Do you have a question? Please ask it on http://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/vscode -->

The following lines in CNTK's Makefile appear to break syntax highlighting in VSCode. The first breaks all highlighting after it, and the nested ifdefs don't show up highlighted as "ifdef". I don't know enough about any of this to say whether this is a VSCode or CNTK problem, but thought I'd start here :)

Apologies for weird markdown due to code

1. Line 103
```
CXXVER_GE480:= $(shell expr `$(CXX) -dumpversion | sed -e 's/\.\([0-9][0-9]\)/\1/g' -e 's/\.\([0-9]\)/0\1/g' -e 's/^[0-9]\{3,4\}$$/&00/'` \>= 40800)
```
2. Line 122
```
ifdef CUDA_PATH
  ifndef GDK_INCLUDE_PATH
```
- VSCode Version:
Version 1.11.2
Commit 6eaebe3b9c70406d67c97779468c324a7a95db0e
Date 2017-04-13T08:03:11.395Z
Shell 1.4.6
Renderer 53.0.2785.143
Node 6.5.0
- OS Version:
Windows 10 Creator's Update

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Open https://github.com/Microsoft/CNTK/blob/master/Makefile

data.title: Debugging: Unable to halt execution using arm gdb
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.11.2 (1.11.2)
- OS Version: MacOS Sierra 10.12.3

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Setup launch.json to use arm-none-eabi-gdb for debugging a c program on an embedded target (see attached launch.txt)
2. Set one breakpoint to beginning of main
3. Start debug session
4. Breakpoint in main fires. Press "play" button to continue
5. Try to halt the target by pressing "pause"

The result is  that nothing happens. Any attempt to use the debug console results is
"Unable to perform this action because the process is running."

The way to halt the execution when using command line arm-none-eabi-gdb is to press ctrl-c (SIGINT?). Could this option be added to vscode debugger config?

[launch.txt](https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/files/959517/launch.txt)

data.title: Cannot read property 'resource' of null when adding new debug configuration
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code 1.11.2 (6eaebe3b9c70406d67c97779468c324a7a95db0e, 2017-04-13T08:03:11.395Z)
- OS Version: Windows_NT ia32 10.0.15063
- Extensions: 

|Extension|Author|Version|
|---|---|---|
|html-snippets|abusaidm|0.1.0|
|vscode-eslint|dbaeumer|1.2.8|
|beautify|HookyQR|1.0.2|
|csharp|ms-vscode|1.9.0|
|PowerShell|ms-vscode|0.12.2|
|debugger-for-chrome|msjsdiag|3.0.1|
|vscode-icons|robertohuertasm|7.6.0|
|vscode-react-native|vsmobile|0.3.2|
|markdown-pdf|yzane|0.1.7|;


---

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Open Visual Studio Code
2. Ctrl-Shift-D to activate Debug Pane

Result:
There is no Debug Configuration dropdown displayed on top of debug pane.
Moreover when clicking in menu Debug > Add Configuration, I get an error "Cannot read property 'resource' of null". I cannot add a Debug Configuration.

data.title: Is that possible to use this flat badge in the official document or README?
data.body:
- [![visual studio](https://cdn.rawgit.com/aleen42/badges/master/src/visual_studio.svg)](https://cdn.rawgit.com/aleen42/badges/master/src/visual_studio.svg)
- [![visual studio code](https://cdn.rawgit.com/aleen42/badges/master/src/visual_studio_code.svg)](https://cdn.rawgit.com/aleen42/badges/master/src/visual_studio_code.svg)

I have created flat badges for both Visual Studio and Visual Studio Code through my project, named [**badges**](https://github.com/aleen42/badges). This is a repository for providing a tool to generate badges programmatically, and for collecting badges, which hopes to be widely used in documenting. Therefore, I hope this project can use it too. Is that possible? If you appreciate it, I can give a pull request to update documenting in this project. Furthermore, the open sourced project, [Apollo 11](https://github.com/chrislgarry/Apollo-11) has also used a NASA badge for docuementing.

data.title: Cannot save a file when the name consists only from numbers

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
This may be related to https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues/451, possibly a regression.

- VSCode Version: 1.11.2
- OS Version: Windows 10 x64 Pro

Steps to Reproduce:

1.  Open VSCode
2.  Open a new tab and write something
3.  Open the Save dialog
4.  Switch the file type to All files (*)
5.  Enter a filename consisting only from numbers (like 421220850306)
6.  Click Save
7. You get an error saying "The file name is not valid"

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/4746070/25449228/6f58c1b6-2abb-11e7-84f9-14d3836279ad.png)

data.title: Typings Installer continuously runs and consumes lots of resources
data.body:
<!-- Do you have a question? Please ask it on http://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/vscode -->

- VSCode Version: 1.11.2
- OS Version: Windows 10

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Open a NodeJS project in VS Code

VS Code will run some Typings installer in the background:

    "C:\Program Files (x86)\Microsoft VS Code\Code.exe" "c:\Program Files (x86)\Microsoft VS Code\resources\app\extensions\node_modules\typescript\lib/typingsInstaller.js" --globalTypingsCacheLocation C:/Users/Oliver/AppData/Local/Microsoft/TypeScript --enableTelemetry

This process continuously performs I/O and uses a 100% of 1 core. The process never seems to complete. The process with the command line quoted above has been running at this resource usage for over 1 hour.

I am not aware of what special condition causes this as this seems to be a constant state on my machine.

data.title: Feature request: "when" for inQuickOpen without text entry
data.body:
Could we get a "when" clause context for when quick-open is in focus, but we don't have an entry for writing text? A use case would be if we bind 

workbench.action.openNextRecentlyUsedEditorInGroup

to another key than Ctrl-tab, since then the list of open editors remains until we confirm with Enter. It would be useful since we then could rebind a single key to selecting next/previous in that list, as opposed to having to use a modifier, i.e. we can use just "n" instead of "Ctrl+n"
